alert.note: Alert for Motherlode (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 04 at 2:23AM PST until January 05 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE MOSQUITO, CALDOR WEST, AND RIVER BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Mosquito burn scar, Caldor West burn scar, and River burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following area, Motherlode. * WHEN...From this afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Mosquito, Caldor West, and River burn scar is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near the Mosquito, Caldor West, and River burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Mosquito, Caldor West, and River burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following area, Motherlode. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. Area rivers, creeks, and streams are running high, particularly along the Consumes and Mokelumne Rivers, and are expected to rise with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
